Jacksonian |h-majority = Jacksonian |sessionnumber1 = 1st |sessionstart1 =
December 7, 1835 |sessionend1 = July 4, 1836 |sessionnumber2 = 2nd
|sessionstart2 = December 5, 1836 |sessionend2 = March 3, 1837 |previous = 23rd
|next = 25th }} The 'Twenty-fourth United States Congress' was a meeting of the
legislative branch of the United States federal government, consisting of the
United States Senate and the United States House of Representatives. It met in
Washington, D.C. from March 4, 1835 to March 4, 1837, during the seventh and
eighth years of Andrew Jackson's presidency. The apportionment of seats in the
House of Representatives was based on the Fifth Census of the United States in
1830. Both chambers had a Jacksonian majority.
